snippet: The finding, involving peacekeepers in Mali who killed three civilians protesting outside their base in January, resurrects the question of how to hold United Nations personnel accountable for misconduct.
abstract: United Nations inquiry finds peacekeepers in Mali used excessive force when they fired on civilian protesters outside their base in January; finding highlights ongoing questions of how to hold UN personnel accountable for misconduct.
lead_paragraph: The finding, involving peacekeepers in Mali who killed three civilians protesting outside their base in January, resurrects the question of how to hold United Nations personnel accountable for misconduct.

headline.main: Inquiry Finds ‘Excessive Force’ by U.N. Officers in Mali Killings
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Finds ‘Excessive Force’ by U.N. Peacekeepers
